properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 16 at 9:14PM MST until February 16 at 10:15PM MST by NWS Missoula MT
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Missoula has issued a

* Snow Squall Warning for...
South central Missoula County in west central Montana...
North central Granite County in west central Montana...

* Until 1015 PM MST.

* At 914 PM MST, a dangerous area of intense snow was located 10
miles southeast of Bonner-West Riverside, or 13 miles southeast of
Missoula, and is nearly stationary.

HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow.
Wind gusts up to 20 mph.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.

* Interstate 90 Turah to Bearmouth.

Locations impacted include...
Nimrod, Clinton, Turah and Bearmouth.
properties.instruction:
Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes
your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra
time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead
to accidents.

Reduce your speed! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly
drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.

If traveling on a highway, find the nearest exit or rest area and
park safely away from traffic. Allow snow squalls to pass before
attempting to resume travel.

CMAMtext: Snow Squall Warning til 10:15 PM MST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
